components.name: Fiberglass (C-Glass)
components.notes: Based on C-type glass, the most common type of glass for fiberglass insulation

components.name: Fiberglass (E-Glass)
components.notes: Assumed to be "E-glass" the most commonly used type of glass for continuous filament fiber (see ASM source)

environmental.systemBoundary: The composition of the duct board is 81% fiberglass, 12% binder, and 7% facing materials. The cradle-to-gate includes raw materials acquisition, inbound transport of materials, and manufacturing, including packaging and waste treatment. Manufacturing includes the following stages batch-->melter-->binder-->finishing-->facing. Cradle-to-gate results include plant overhead.  Background study excluded any processing of recycled cullet due to lack of data.

name: Fiberglass Board Insulation
description: Fiberglass board insulation liner is used to insulate the insides of metal heating and cooling ductwork or plenums. In addition to providing thermal insulation in areas where the carried air is cooler or warmer than the ambient air surrounding the ductwork, fiberglass board insulation liner also provides acoustical insulation, damping the noise of the HVAC system as well as cutting down on cross-talk. Fiberglass board insulation is made up of a fiber base held together by a binder. This substrate is then covered with a mat of densely-packed continuous filiament glass fibers and an acrylic coating; together this is known as "air stream surfacing". This air stream surfacing protects the surface of the fiberglass board exposed to airflow in the duct, protecting it from damage and moisture. Fiberglass board insulation is affixed to the metal ductwork or plenum using both an adhesive and mechanical fasteners which are outside of the scope of this CP.

sources.name: NAIMA Fiberglass LCA
sources.url:
North American Insulation Manufacturers Association (NAIMA)
